remarks: Construct lexicographic order on a function space based on a reverse well-ordering of the indexes and a well-ordering of the values. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 3-Jul-2019.)
statement:
wemapwe.t $e |- T = { <. x , y >. | E. z e. A ( ( x ` z ) S ( y ` z ) /\ A. w e. A ( z R w -> ( x ` w ) = ( y ` w ) ) ) } $.
wemapwe.u $e |- U = { x e. ( B ^m A ) | x finSupp Z } $.
wemapwe.2 $e |- ( ph -> R We A ) $.
wemapwe.3 $e |- ( ph -> S We B ) $.
wemapwe.4 $e |- ( ph -> B =/= (/) ) $.
wemapwe.5 $e |- F = OrdIso ( R , A ) $.
wemapwe.6 $e |- G = OrdIso ( S , B ) $.
wemapwe.7 $e |- Z = ( G ` (/) ) $.
wemapwe $p |- ( ph -> T We U ) $.
$d A w x y z $.
$d B x y $.
$d F w x y z $.
$d G x y $.
$d R w z $.
$d S z $.
$d U x y $.
$d Z x $.
$d ph x y $.
